snippet: With a new art museum and performance space, Bernard Arnault and LVMH are offering Paris a big gift — one that also has implications for the giver.
abstract: Profile of Bernard Arnault, chairman and chief executive of LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton, who is poised to open the Foundation Louis Vuitton in Paris following ten years of preparation and significant expense; museum, designed by Frank Gehry and housing LVMH's extensive art collection, was built on public land and will revert to city ownership in 50 years; Arnault hopes that effort will help shift his wolfish public image and that of his company.
lead_paragraph: With a new art museum and performance space, Bernard Arnault and LVMH are offering Paris a big gift — one that also has implications for the giver.
